alert.note: Alert for Clark; Jackson; Trempealeau (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 09 at 5:26PM CST until January 10 at 6:00AM CST by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Heavy Snow Continues Across Southwest Wisconsin And Far Northeast Iowa... .Heavy snow continued to fall across the far northeast corner of Iowa and southwest Wisconsin at early evening. Another 1-2" of snow is expected in these areas through 8 pm with the snow then tapering off, exiting east before midnight. Meanwhile, strong northerly winds will gust from 30 to 40 mph mostly south of Interstate 90 this evening, decreasing overnight. Drifting snow will further hamper slippery to hazardous travel conditions. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM CST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Snow with additional accumulations up to 1 inch. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...In Minnesota, Winona County. In Wisconsin, Clark, Trempealeau and Jackson Counties. * WHEN...Until 6 AM CST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions will impact the evening commute.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. In Minnesota, visit 511mn.org for road conditions. In Wisconsin, visit 511wi.gov for road conditions.
